resources.string: Help us identify issues and improve Element dbg by sharing anonymous usage data. To understand how people use multiple devices, we’ll generate a random identifier, shared by your devices.\n\nYou can read all our terms %s.
Help improve Element dbg
Element dbg Web\nElement dbg Desktop
Element dbg iOS\nElement dbg Android
Element dbg Call Failed
Please launch Element dbg on another device that can decrypt the message so it can send the keys to this session.
Element dbg is also great for the workplace. It’s trusted by the world’s most secure organisations.
Welcome to Element dbg,\n%s.
For your privacy, Element dbg only supports sending hashed user email addresses and phone numbers.
This identity server is outdated. Element dbg support only API V2.

Element dbg needs to perform a clear cache to be up to date, for the following reason:
%s

Note that this action will restart the app and it may take some time.
🔐️ Join me on Element dbg
Hey, talk to me on Element dbg: %s
Please delete the passphrase if you want Element dbg to generate a recovery key.
Element dbg policy
%s in Settings to receive invites directly in Element dbg.
Element dbg Live Location
Element dbg could not access your location. Please try again later.
Element dbg could not access your location
Element dbg Android
Not implemented yet in Element dbg
To simplify your Element dbg, tabs are now optional. Manage them using the top-right menu.
Element dbg needs permission to access your camera and your microphone to perform video calls.\n\nPlease allow access on the next pop-ups to be able to make the call.
Element dbg needs permission to display notifications. Notifications can display your messages, your invitations, etc.\n\nPlease allow access on the next pop-ups to be able to view notification.
Element dbg needs permission to access your microphone to perform audio calls.
Get help with using Element dbg
Element dbg requires you to enter your credentials to perform this action.
Element dbg encountered an issue when rendering content of event with id \'%1$s\'
Element dbg does not handle events of type \'%1$s\'
Element dbg Screen Sharing
Element dbg will sync in background in way that preserves the device’s limited resources (battery).\nDepending on your device resource state, the sync may be deferred by the operating system.

Element dbg will sync in background periodically at precise time (configurable).\nThis will impact radio and battery usage, there will be a permanent notification displayed stating that Element dbg is listening for events.
Use default Element dbg ringtone for incoming calls
Element dbg may crash more often when an unexpected error occurs
Element dbg collects anonymous analytics to allow us to improve the application.
PIN code is required every time you open Element dbg.
PIN code is required after 2 minutes of not using Element dbg.
PIN code is the only way to unlock Element dbg.
Element dbg is not affected by Battery Optimization.
Background restrictions are enabled for Element dbg.\nWork that the app tries to do will be aggressively restricted while it is in the background, and this could affect notifications.\n%1$s
Background restrictions are disabled for Element dbg. This test should be run using mobile data (no WIFI).\n%1$s
Notifications are not enabled for this session.\nPlease check the Element dbg settings.
[%1$s]\nThis error is out of control of Element dbg. There is no Google account on the phone. Please open the account manager and add a Google account.

[%1$s]\nThis error is out of control of Element dbg. It can occur for several reasons. Maybe it will work if you retry later, you can also check that Google Play Service is not restricted in data usage in the system settings, or that your device clock is correct, or it can happen on custom ROM.

[%1$s]\nThis error is out of control of Element dbg and according to Google, this error indicates that the device has too many apps registered with FCM. The error only occurs in cases where there are extreme numbers of apps, so it should not affect the average user.
Element dbg uses Google Play Services to deliver push messages but it doesn’t seem to be configured correctly:\n%1$s
The service will not start when the device is restarted, you will not receive notifications until Element dbg has been opened once.
Element dbg needs the permission to show notifications.\nPlease grant the permission.
The current session is for user %1$s and you provide credentials for user %2$s. This is not supported by Element dbg.\nPlease first clear data, then sign in again on another account.
Use the latest Element dbg on your other devices:
Use the latest Element dbg on your other devices, Element dbg Web, Element dbg Desktop, Element dbg iOS, Element dbg for Android, or another cross-signing capable Matrix client
